title: What songs are considered oldies? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is largely based on the era you grew up or were a young adult in. My local oldies station, WHTG 1410 AM/100.7 FM out of Eatontown, NJ, seems to operate on these rules: The world begins sometime in the early/mid-50’s and ends (with a few exceptions like Gary US Bonds ‘This Little Girl’) sharply in mid/late 1976. It is a bit of a limiter, but on the other hand, I get to hear the top 40-ish of that era, as opposed to just the top 10-ish. Plus, they play something heard even more rarely; charting covers of oldies performed by artists other than their originators or most popular artist. This station was the first I heard of Stevie Wonder’s cover of ‘We Can Work It Out’. We will not speak of the banished CBS-FM 101.1, who now considers 1980’s as oldies, and who once transformed into the hated JACK!
